channel.title: GPU Temperatures
channel.description:
Are the following idle temperatures bad/decent/good?
[img]http://gyazo.com/19d337a045af6066aa42dc1163f63fbe.png[/img]
I finally got my new case and swapped every piece over, which was a pain in the butt since it was my first time doing it; however, it was really fun.

item.title: GPU Temperatures
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:16, topic:519371”]Does your CPU not bottleneck at all? I have the same CPU with a 5850 but was thinking of getting the 660Ti or 670.

I’ve been told those cards will be useless without a CPU upgrade.[/quote]
The performance is still “okay”, but yes, it does definitely bottleneck, and to a point that you can actually notice.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:

How about you all drop it and get back to the topic. That all looks good, my Asus laptop idles CPU around 20C and CPU around 42C so your doing fine.

item.title: GPU Temperatures
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:10, topic:519371”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=637833.msg4300180#msg4300180 date=1368857428]

[quote author=Lin link=topic=637833.msg4300163#msg4300163 date=1368853976]

Really? You couldn’t look into this at all before posting? I’m so loveing sick of this section and the lazy asses who can’t Google a thing to save their lives.

I don’t even see how you could be so loveing disrespectful and this is another reason I really loveing hate a lot of members on this community. I’ve kept my thoughts about other people to myself for way too long, and I used to really respect you. This is the General Questions board, and I’m pretty sure you can Google almost any type of logical question that can be asked. And just so you know, I’ve actually looked up this stuff myself, but I thought I would a second opinion from members in a community that I’m quite familiar with.

On a formal note, please read the rules of this section:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,365884.0.html
[/quote]You know what, you’re right. I’m an asshole and I assumed you were just looking for us to do your work. However, the reality of it is if at least one person didn’t ask then Google wouldn’t be worth it. I apologize. However, you have to understand where I’m coming from. After being here for so long, or even just looking at the front page you see so many questions that can be answered by spending a little bit of time on Google, but instead they take the easy way out and skip straight to asking us - the members who either know it or usually end up Googling themselves.
[/quote]Yea, but dicks like you like to assume. Maybe you’re an older member, but that doesn’t give you the reason to act like an ignorant prick. If you’re tired of people “asking before googling,” go find another board or a whole new hobby entirely. Your arrogance and ego are HUGE and you need to calm the fuck down.

either learn what the word ‘ignorant’ means and use it in the correct context or shut up [sup]lol[/sup] …[/quote]

Ignorance is a state of being uninformed (lack of knowledge).[1] The word ignorant is an adjective describing a person in the state of being unaware and is often used as an insult to describe individuals who deliberately ignore or disregard important information or facts. Ignoramus is commonly used in the US, the UK, and Ireland as a term for someone who is willfully ignorant.

I am more than informed on the definition of Ignorance. Lin doesn’t know what hes fucking talking about. He likes to assume. He is not informed on the research someone might of done before posting here, which he claims everyone hasn’t done.

Read full topic

item.title: GPU Temperatures
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:6, topic:519371”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=637833.msg4299610#msg4299610 date=1368759544]

Really? You couldn’t look into this at all before posting? I’m so loveing sick of this section and the lazy asses who can’t Google a thing to save their lives.

I don’t even see how you could be so loveing disrespectful and this is another reason I really loveing hate a lot of members on this community. I’ve kept my thoughts about other people to myself for way too long, and I used to really respect you. This is the General Questions board, and I’m pretty sure you can Google almost any type of logical question that can be asked. And just so you know, I’ve actually looked up this stuff myself, but I thought I would a second opinion from members in a community that I’m quite familiar with.

On a formal note, please read the rules of this section:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


[/quote]You know what, you’re right. I’m an asshole and I assumed you were just looking for us to do your work. However, the reality of it is if at least one person didn’t ask then Google wouldn’t be worth it. I apologize. However, you have to understand where I’m coming from. After being here for so long, or even just looking at the front page you see so many questions that can be answered by spending a little bit of time on Google, but instead they take the easy way out and skip straight to asking us - the members who either know it or usually end up Googling themselves.[/quote]
The point isn’t about using Google itself, although I’m quite possible of looking up information via a search engine, as I’m sure quite a large group of people can do the same. I did not post here to get someone to “do my work”, because I mentioned I did research beforehand to find a reasonable temperature to base my opinions off of. I posted this, with a question in mind, to see what other people in this community thought.

I understand where you are coming from, as I’m sure everyone else does to. There are different groups of people in the community that determine the types of questions to asked, whether they are simplistic or advanced questions. The rules of this section determined that my question would meet the requirements of this board, so I posted it. I assure you that I would not post something that is extremely simple.

Read full topic

item.title: GPU Temperatures
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

My CPU temp on idle was around 20-25 degrees and GPU was around 40. This is also with stock cooler though so could probably be improved.

Read full topic

item.title: GPU Temperatures
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Yeah that’s pretty darn good…“most” nongaming computers should stay below like 62 degrees.

Gaming computers if I remember right should be like 30-40 degrees?

When you start hitting 70’s-80’s that’s when you need to be worried.

Read full topic
